unit_learning_outcomes.description: integrate critical self-reflexive methods and skills to assess own work and effort.
synthesise ideas, concepts and processes in order to interpret and devise a creative project.
evaluate projects for performance within production deadlines and resource constrain
communicate in creative contexts, evaluate and respond to peer feedback.

assessments.description: Individual engagement with course content will be demonstrated through writing tasks in response to in-class practical exercises and readings.

Students will produce an individual performance with an emphasis on its aesthetic, creative and innovative qualities. This includes a written reflection of the process of the performance, as well as the performance itself. Examples may include dance composition, musical work and theatrical performance. Refer to iLearn for further information.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: Creativity lies at the core of the contemporary performing arts and entertainment industries. This unit explores a variety of creative approaches and students develop key practical and conceptual skills necessary for undertaking independent creative practice. Students will explore performance processes across a wide range of forms and disciplines so that they are able to develop a performance project, using production elements such as live performance, sound, light, and video. No prior experience of the performing arts and entertainment industries is required.
data.title: Creative Process to Performance
